column4: Ok, so I had Feisty 64 bit on sda1, I installed Sabayon on hda1 and it's grub didn't recognize ubuntu, so I cannot access my partition
I am on a live ubuntu64 feisty cd,
and I can't seem to run grub-install
it keeps saying cant find device /dev/sda1
it says /dev/sda1: Not found or not a block device.
it says /dev/sda1: Not found or not a block device
when I boot from Sabayon grub, or when I chroot in from ubuntu live disk and try to run grub-install
do you see sda1 in the list produced by "sudo sfdisk -l" (after chrooting into your ubuntu install)?
do you see the file /etc/debian_version on the partition supposedly containing ubuntu?
I posted my /boot/grub/menu.lst from the partition on pastebin
so it it is indeed ubuntu. is also supposed that sabayon overwritten the partition
no, sabayon is on a different partition, I can tell by the contents of the home directory on the partition
menu.lst does not do any good if you don't have the /proc file system. something is really rotten but i don't know waht
is there a way to chroot differently so I will have a /proc?
yes - you can use your current /proc fs. but i don't remember the command. i'll try to find a pointer for you
